wikipedia_page.main: John Linacre (born 13 December 1955 in Middlesbrough) is an English retired professional footballer who is best known for his time spent with Hartlepool United, where he made over 200 league appearances in two spells with the club.

response: Pathology, epidemiology, dermatology, and the history of medicine were the subjects in which Payne took most interest. His first major contribution to the history of medicine was a life of John Linacre prefixed to a facsimile of the 1521 Cambridge edition of his Latin version of Galen, De Temperamentis (Cambridge, 1881). In 1896 he delivered the Harveian oration at the College of Physicians on the relation of William Harvey to Galen, and in 1900 wrote a life of Thomas Sydenham. He read (21 January 1901) a paper before the Bibliographical Society On the "Herbarius" and "Hortus Sanitatis."
